title: Grades 11/12
subject: Extended Evidence Outcomes: Reading, Writing, Communicating (2020-)

3D21ABF2883841BF9BAAE13AC3379D05.description:
Apply grades 11-12 Essential Elements for Reading Standards to
informational text (e.g., “Compare and contrast reasoning and
arguments used in one’s work with those used in seminal U.S. texts.”)
(EE.W.11-12.9b).

699F6A0BD128403F847BB3E66099EC20.description:
Apply grades 11-12 Essential Elements for Reading Standards to
literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast elements of American literature
to other literary works, self, or one’s world [Compare themes, topics,
locations, context, and point of view].”) (EE.W.11-12.9a).

D9A8F086CEEB44B2A94FFF5643F714F5.description: Cite evidence from literary or informational texts (EE.W.11-12.9).

62FAF33891E34D74A6C6D04CB39428AD.description: Cite resources using a formatting template.

3FB119ABA3284D87B207BCC4B3E9A2C6.description:
Write answers to research questions by selecting relevant information from
multiple resources (EE.W.11-12.8).

E399FD3F01DB421991FF5CAF99D0B070.description:
Conduct research projects to answer questions posed by self and others
using multiple sources of information (EE.W.11-12.7).

719093A62E18421C8BBB4A2F5652AB85.description: Students Can, with Guidance and Support:

144B7C8E71544796A18CCA52E16412B6.description:
Synthesize multiple, authoritative literary and/or informational sources to answer questions or solve problems, producing well-organized
and developed research projects that defend information, conclusions, and solutions.

587F22693C964AD698F7FBD790A54849.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection,
and revision) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences (EE.W.11-12.10).

E3ED47F5380A415780987BF7A69AB30F.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to produce, publish and update an
individual or shared writing project (EE.W.11-12.6).

5E4A837E7CCB4222A7B55E067802E94D.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing,
and rewriting (EE.W.11-12.5).

CA0CEE72CC2C4FBB90E003147EF81122.description:
Produce writing that is appropriate to a particular task, purpose, and
audience (EE.W.11-12.4).

AA66204C484D459E927F30D777368A37.description:
Vary sentence structure using a variety of simple and compound
sentence structures (EE.L.11-12.3a).

ADAE5C74C5EA4BEE962D8A7C5A033D69.description:
Use language to achieve desired outcomes when communicating (EE.L.11-
12.3).

9EC950E8592C48A6B9C97F7C73CD87F0.description:
Spell most single-syllable words correctly and apply knowledge of word
chunks in spelling longer words.

BF6E938652CD48A89D0712B697261ECE.description:
Demonstrate conventions of standard English including capitalization,
ending punctuation, and spelling when writing.

5F55E73286614DAB8F15958418EB932F.description:
Demonstrate understanding of conventions of standard English (EE.L.11-
12.2).

4C42871751264D75B3BEE9DC0B6BAC2C.description:
Use digital, electronic, and other resources and tools to improve uses of
language as needed (EE.L.11-12.1b).

84F35EBD3BEB47268DD8E70FA7C5ACE9.description: Use conventions of standard English when needed (EE.L.11-12.1a).

EB48741DCCB544549E4F2086382A6024.description:
Demonstrate standard English grammar and usage when communicating
(EE.L.11-12.1).

41E17D1A2FDC4A85867BB123E5CDA66A.description: Students Can, with Guidance and Support:

11695D25CED846A7B86DE279ADC55B24.description: Use a recursive writing process to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing projects in response to ongoing feedback.

EFC16D8CE7194541B51B82E58DE8BAE5.description:
Use descriptive words and phrases to convey a vivid picture of
experiences, events, setting, or characters (EE.W.11-12.3d).

494D9AE397354DDF93AEBBF903F1C84E.description:
Organize the events in the narrative using temporal words to signal
order and add cohesion (EE.W.11-12.3c).

79C2267E5C4046379E22C33E916D5D5A.description:
Write a narrative about a problem, situation, or observation including at
least one character, details, and clearly sequenced events (EE.W.11-
12.3a).

EBDF4F4E58DB4728BAE380EF4C7800DC.description: Write about events or personal experiences (EE.W.11-12.3).

2FC963E943544E64B3EA2D469BBB7B62.description: Students Can, with Guidance and Support:

38703D7798A54B6AAE2AFD3761BC7517.description: Write engaging and significant real or imagined narratives that build toward a particular tone or outcome.

DBD2C2419AB5430C889E205AF7D42ECF.description: Provide a closing or concluding statement (EE.W.11-12.2f).

69430B1BCEE949509C0F73470DC66B45.description:
Use domain specific vocabulary when writing claims related to a topic of
study or text (EE.W.11-12.2d).

C56536D3F7EC4E82B1D1C799C0D7FA67.description:
Use complete, simple sentences, as well as compound and other
complex sentences as appropriate (EE.W.11-12.2c).

74E61AD73C5E4D1A8C9A8D0579B7132C.description:
Develop the topic with relevant, facts, details, or quotes (EE.W.11-
12.2b).

96DF7CCA9D924270A4A9277843622274.description:
Introduce a topic clearly and write an informative or explanatory text that
conveys ideas, concepts, and information including visual, tactual, or
multimedia information as appropriate (EE.W.11-12.2a).

51F0507CDA8744C8AE6C5CDFFE22E024.description: Students Can, with Guidance and Support:

1A72C1949A7D4FEDBC1E018771E76D40.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of
content.

E6BB6B9C81B040ED8F8B2C45CA9D9653.description: Support claims with reasons and evidence drawn from text.

EB6A06CBA0DC4067A732C3CA1628AB36.description:
Write an argument to support a claim that results from studying a topic
or reading a text.

CC8993C833FE4107A850BF0582EA91C1.description: Students Can, with Guidance and Support:

E46CC2A5E185430098A69FA615D837AC.description:
Write thoughtful, well-developed arguments that support knowledgeable and significant claims, anticipating and addressing the
audience’s values and biases.

24FFE517538C4035BFABC0F3EA1FA11B.description:
Use general academic and domain-specific words and phrases across
contexts (EE.L.11-12.6).

22E2F31C54694B39BCF9009E62F2235F.description:
Interpret simple figures of speech encountered while reading or
listening (e.g., metaphors, analogies) (EE.L.11-12.5a).

DCE8FA99A3C04FCBACA374E886E12E9B.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and use (EE.L.11-12.5).

149D0B178E654BC4B535E2488D8B9B2A.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g., print and adapted dictionaries, online
vocabulary supports) to clarify the meaning of unfamiliar words
encountered when reading (EE.L.11-12.4d).

C9B9BED2DC4F4A2081D5CD9F2BBB2FD3.description:
Identify and use root words and the words that result when affixes are
added or removed (EE.L.11-12.4b).

9E89A159DA5D4F78B8F30BB4F737EDD6.description:
Use context to determine the meaning of unknown words (EE.L.11-
12.4a).

C9B6747A9C5B43C8847739B252E29165.description: Students Can, with Guidance and Support:

A2641878A87644969644490692E597BF.description: Understand how language influences the comprehension of narrative, argumentative, and informational texts.

77A5DD1621FB44399CB7062F65CC8D37.description:
Demonstrate understanding while actively engaged in reading or listening
to literary non-fiction (EE.RI.11-12.10).

3F0C4D659B374D5091DF322A9F71C134.description:
Compare and contrast arguments made by two different texts on the
same topic (EE.RI.11-12.9).

1C9E9BF2A27C44AB9B9998D59D7F8C7A.description:
Determine whether the claims and reasoning enhance the author’s
argument in an informational text (EE.RI.11-12.8).

F9CD6B5661D8436FAA091A735C672CAB.description:
Analyze information presented in different media on related topics to
answer questions or solve problems (EE.RI.11-12.7).

7BB528CCFE034AD085EDB80561CB62EF.description:
Determine author’s point of view and compare and contrast it with own
point of view (EE.RI.11-12.6).

EE1EE71BC1BB4FE7827AABC37086FFAF.description:
Determine whether the structure of a text enhances the author’s claim
(EE.RI.11-12.5).

A73073EE651344A8917AAE6EB480BBAE.description:
Determine how words or phrases in a text, including words with multiple
meanings and figurative language, impacts the meaning of the text
(EE.RI.11-12.4).

5402CE3C121E4A7C8C87FB712CA2E909.description:
Determine how individuals, ideas, or events change over the course of
the text (EE.RI.11-12.3).

4B99FA01D44E48149EC672ECA5E0CAE9.description: Determine the central idea of a text (EE.RI.11-12.2).

A8EF226CC6AB4741B56FA9FC8608CF14.description:
Analyze a text to determine its meaning and cite textual evidence to
support explicit and implicit understanding (EE.RI.11-12.1).

09B49B23766E466186B6BDD7DF7CBEE5.description: Students Can, with Guidance and Support:

D97616AC97B04FB59289D141D46E1090.description: Interpret and evaluate complex informational texts using various critical reading strategies.

87CBBBD520584BFE9F3B222EC34FFF46.description:
Demonstrate understanding while actively engaged in reading or listening
to stories, dramas, or poems (EE.RL.11-12.10).

8ED92FCD3793476EBF335E83F13F1D10.description:
Demonstrate explicit understanding of recounted versions of
foundational works of American literature (EE.RL.11-12.9).

CB731DF7B4D94A4D9ACDA02E9704DC73.description:
Compare two or more interpretations (e.g., recorded or live production of a
play or recorded novel or poetry) of a story, drama, or poem (EE.RL.11-
12.7).

6D4D39DC4F524437AF69AB58E140FED3.description:
Determine how words or phrases in a text, including words with multiple
meanings and figurative language, impact the meaning (EE.RL.11-12.4).

EAA50BC1D104455C8758197AC84F398B.description:
Determine how characters, the setting or events change over the course
of the story or drama (EE.RL.11-12.3).

4F862A6C134245D9923FE978545F9748.description:
Recount the main events of the text which are related to the theme or
central idea (EE.RL.11-12.2).

6F62780E6DFF4C72840EA33785113BAC.description:
Analyze a text to determine its meaning and cite textual evidence to
support explicit and implicit understandings (EE.RL.11.12.1).

A971E577DE7E48DD9823FF6242E2F991.description: Students Can, with Guidance and Support:

8C9F3DE2706844D7A21D6E54563C5033.description: Interpret and evaluate complex literature using various critical reading strategies.

52F79222C2F0451FB8B8EF9F39F373EB.description:
Adapt communication to a variety of contexts and tasks using complete
sentences when indicated or appropriate (EE.SL.11-12.6).

8E0846032B4E4684A135DA6A8254BEDD.description:
Use digital media strategically (e.g., textual, graphical, audio, visual, and
interactive elements) in presentations to support understanding and add
interest (EE.SL.11-12.5).

BA7794352DB6460AB3B3DC55D202EFB9.description:
Present an argument on a topic using an organization appropriate to the
purpose, audience, and task (EE.SL.11-12.4).

04CFC6A66FF646B48CD31D0A35AA576E.description: Students Can, with Guidance and Support:

C055D43A440A427894844CE0CD78451C.description: Integrate credible, accurate information into appropriate media and formats to meet an audience’s needs.

D714C51755FA45F68F0697CFAAFA856B.description:
Determine whether the claims and reasoning enhance the speaker’s
argument on a topic (EE.SL.11-12.3).

6DCF7216A68E4B8C9FA6E99B478469BF.description:
Determine the credibility and accuracy of information presented across
diverse media or formats (EE.SL.11-12.2).

11EF017097BB4A8DB3ADC2EDFF396079.description: Respond to agreements and disagreements in a discussion.

940C034F34D04AA09E33A8577F0EAE1F.description:
Ask and answer questions to verify or clarify own ideas and
understandings during a discussion.

663ACA30699B46638D6C33D9FCB3E448.description: Work with peers to set rules and goals for discussions.

37D06D5D57184070A7F69B788DCFACF9.description: Prepare for discussions by collecting information on the topic.

3D59E3EEFE764F68BEBF0E85E28833AD.description: Students Can, with Guidance and Support:

F27254D5E7FD4797820BACDA171A18E2.description: Follow collaborative guidelines to ensure a hearing of a full range of positions on a topic or issue, and evaluate responses.
